text: Jo Min-ki (November 5, 1965 â€“ March 9, 2018) was a South Korean actor, photographer and professor. He was best known for his roles in the television series Love and Ambition, East of Eden, Queen Seondeok, and Flames of Desire. From 2010 until his resignation in February 2018, he was an assistant professor at Cheongju University. On February 22, 2018, Jo was accused of sexually harassing his students, which he initially denied. He resigned from his teaching position at Cheongju University. A week later, Jo confirmed the accusations were true and was soon arrested. Jo was found dead at an underground parking lot in Seoul in an apparent suicide by hanging on March 9, 2018 at the age of 52. ==References== Category:1966 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Actors who committed suicide Category:Suicides by hanging Category:South Korean television actors Category:South Korean academics Category:Photographers Category:Actors from Seoul
title: Jo Min-ki
